title: Hollyoaks spoilers: Breda reveals the truth about her crimes?
text:
(Picture: Lime Pictures)

Breda McQueen has been on a killing spree in Hollyoaks for the best part of a year, cleansing the village of those whom she believes to be bad dads. However, the truth about her crimes could be set to out in the coming episodes as — at Goldie’s (Chelsee Healey) request — she speaks to a psychiatrist.

After Sylver (David Tag) and Goldie became worried about Breda’s state of mind, the pair began to investigate what their mum was getting up to — and Goldie became convinced that Breda had been sleeping out in the pig farm. After Goldie confronted her with this, Breda was forced to lie so that the truth could remain hidden. As a result, she promised Goldie that she’d sell the farm.

However, in the coming episodes, Joel (Rory Douglas-Speed) suggests that Goldie should call the estate agent for an update on the farm. The young woman does exactly that, but she’s left perturbed when she realises that the farm was never put on the market in the first place.

Afterwards, Goldie confronts Breda with this new information, but the villainous granny claims that the estate agent is lying — but she’s not convinced by her mum’s explanation, and thus books her an appointment with a psychiatrist.

Later, Breda opens up to Tony (Nick Pickard) about her troubles, and the imprisoned man suggests that she might be better off attending the appointment her daughter’s arranged for her.

As a result, she turns up at the hospital — for no other purpose but to humour everyone. However, it’s pretty clear that she’s incredibly hostile, and in a moment of anger, she reveals too much to the psychiatrist — who’s left incredibly concerned by what she’s said. As a result, Breda storms out.

Afterwards, Breda packs a bag with food, but — before she can leave — she’s stopped in her tracks by Sylver, Goldie and Jack (Jimmy McKenna).

Is the truth finally out?

Will the reason for Breda’s odd behaviour finally come to light?

One to watch: Tuesday 22nd October at 7pm on E4.
